Articles.Content: I was searching for real life spaceplanes on wikipedia, and found the VentureStar, and the X-33, a smaller version, both use linear aerospikes. Within hours of me doing this, I noticed that a modder has made a Linear Aerospike Mod, Scott Manley would mention it in a video, and RLA would put one into production as well. How did I set off this wierd chain reaction of Linear Aerospikes? Am I made of magicalness? Was it all a coincidence? Is someone stalking me and relaying ideas to other people? Did I post something about the Linear Aerospike and don't remember? This all happened within 3 or so days.

No, although that has happened to me before. I have never seen Linear Aerospikes mentioned on the KSP Forums before, and even checked to see references, none of the examples have happened before in recent times that I may have seen it, and none.
Magic. Clearly. It is the only scientific explanation.

Baader-Meinhof phenomenon.

Or, you did see references and your brain just filtered them out because it deemed them unimportant. Your memory isn't perfect you know.

A quick search shows me linear aerospikes have been mentioned dozens of times.

It's happened to me quite often, in fact. I think the first time, I was much younger, at a school playground, and for whatever reason, the Magic Bullet story popped into my little head. As kids began to return to school, a friend asked me - I am not making this up - "Hey, did you ever hear about the Magic Bullet?"

Since then, I have noted the same phenomenon occurring several times in my life. At first I assumed I was psychic.
I got Baader-Meinhof phenomenon'd recently. Someone linked me to the Mass Effect wiki while explain why his kerbals never die, now i see Mass Effect all over the place....

Nooetics. That's why almost every major invention (fire, the radio, calculus, theory of evolution of species, combustion engine, economic marginalism, chemistry of oxygen, restricted relativity, heavier-than-air flight, telephone, jet engine, etc.), ever, has been made about the same time by unrelated people, all over the world
